result.execSummary:
The defendant John Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/full time schooling or combination thereof, or at any time he does not meet that requirement, must perform 10 hours of community service per week.

SAFE program intake completion and any counseling recommended.  AODA. 

DNA sample.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 2:14pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner.  Def appears in person and with Atty Suzanne O'Neill.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW - victim impact statement filed.

State moves to:
Ct. 2 (Battery/DA)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (CDTP/DA)>>NO CONTEST
Ct. 3 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 18 months probation on each count, concurrent.
CONDITONS: SAFE program intake completion and any counseling recommended; AODA; Absolute sobriety; CC including 2 domestic abuse surcharges; DNA sample and two DNA surcharges; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or at any time he does not meet that requirement, he must perform 10 hours community service/week.

>>Defendant awarded 2 days credit on each count in the event of any revocation.

Adj: 2:22pm

Plea hearing at 10-21-2015 02:10 pm.
Final pre-trial at 11-19-2015 09:00 am.
Jury Trial at 12-09-2015 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): N.K.M. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. WPD police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.
